question:
What is the main purpose of the AndroidManifest.xml file in an Android project?
A) To define the app's user interface layout
B) To declare app components, permissions, and configuration settings
C) To store string resources and constants
D) To contain the main application logic

In an Android project structure, where are the layout XML files typically stored?
A) app/src/main/java/
B) app/src/main/assets/
C) app/src/main/res/layout/
D) app/src/main/res/values/

Which method is called when an Android activity is first created?
A) onStart()
B) onResume()
C) onCreate()
D) onDestroy()

What is the correct way to find a View by its ID in an Android activity?
A) getView(R.id.viewId)
B) findViewById(R.id.viewId)
C) findView(R.id.viewId)
D) getViewById(R.id.viewId)

Which XML attribute is used to set the text content of a TextView?
A) android:content
B) android:value
C) android:text
D) android:title

What is the most common parent layout used as the root element in Android XML layouts?
A) RelativeLayout
B) LinearLayout
C) ConstraintLayout
D) FrameLayout

To handle a button click event in Android, which method should you implement?
A) onTouch()
B) onClick()
C) onPress()
D) onTap()

In the project structure, what does the R class represent?
A) Resources class that provides access to app resources
B) Runtime class for app execution
C) Request class for network operations
D) Root class for the application

Which XML attribute is used to assign a unique identifier to a View?
A) android:name
B) android:id
C) android:identifier
D) android:key

For Lab 1's Hello World app, what is the correct way to change a TextView's text programmatically?
A) textView.changeText("New Text")
B) textView.updateText("New Text")
C) textView.setText("New Text")
D) textView.text = "New Text"

Which attribute is used to set the hint text for an EditText component?
A) android:text
B) android:hint
C) android:placeholder
D) android:helperText

What method is called when a Button is clicked and an OnClickListener is implemented?
A) onTouch()
B) onPress()
C) onClick()
D) onTap()

Which input type should be used for an EditText to accept only numeric values?
A) android:inputType="text"
B) android:inputType="number"
C) android:inputType="numeric"
D) android:inputType="integer"

How do you programmatically set text in a TextView?
A) textView.text = "Hello"
B) textView.setText("Hello")
C) textView.setContent("Hello")
D) textView.changeText("Hello")

Which of the following is the correct way to implement OnClickListener using an anonymous inner class?
A) button.setOnClickListener(new OnClickListener() { ... })
B) button.setOnClickListener(new View.OnClickListener() { ... })
C) button.setClickListener(new OnClickListener() { ... })
D) button.addOnClickListener(new View.OnClickListener() { ... })

What method is used to retrieve text from an EditText component?
A) editText.getContent()
B) editText.getValue()
C) editText.getText()
D) editText.readText()

Which attribute makes a Button unclickable?
A) android:clickable="false"
B) android:enabled="false"
C) android:disabled="true"
D) android:interactive="false"

What does the following code do?
kotlinval userInput = editText.getText().toString()
if (userInput.isEmpty()) {
    textView.setText("Please enter some text")
}
A) Clears the EditText if it's empty
B) Checks if EditText is empty and shows a message in TextView
C) Validates if the input is a valid string
D) Converts EditText content to uppercase

Which method should be called to find a view by its ID in an Activity?
A) getViewById()
B) findView()
C) findViewById()
D) locateView()

What is an explicit intent in Android development?
A) An intent that doesn't specify the target component
B) An intent that specifies the exact component (activity) to start
C) An intent that can only be used within the same application
D) An intent that requires user permission to execute

Which method is used to start a new activity using an explicit intent?
A) startActivityForResult()
B) startActivity()
C) launchActivity()
D) Both A and B are correct

What happens when you call finish() method in an activity?
A) The application terminates completely
B) The current activity is destroyed and returns to the previous activity
C) The activity is minimized to background
D) All activities in the task stack are destroyed

Which lifecycle method is called when returning to an activity from another activity?
A) onCreate()
B) onStart()
C) onResume()
D) onRestart()

How do you handle the result returned from a child activity using startActivityForResult()?
A) Override onActivityResult() method
B) Override onResult() method
C) Override onReturn() method
D) Override onFinish() method

What is the purpose of request code in startActivityForResult(int requestCode)?
A) To specify the priority of the activity
B) To identify which activity returned the result in onActivityResult()
C) To set the result code for the activity
D) To define the activity's layout resource ID

Which of the following is required in AndroidManifest.xml for each activity?
A) <activity android:name=".ActivityName" />
B) <intent-filter> for all activities
C) android:exported="true" for all activities
D) android:launchMode specification

Which layout is best suited for arranging views in a single row or column?
A) RelativeLayout
B) LinearLayout
C) ConstraintLayout
D) FrameLayout

In LinearLayout, which attribute is used to specify whether child views are arranged horizontally or vertically?
A) android:layout_direction
B) android:orientation
C) android:layout_gravity
D) android:gravity

What is the main advantage of ConstraintLayout over other layout types?
A) It's easier to code manually
B) It uses less memory
C) It creates flat view hierarchies and provides flexible positioning
D) It only works with Material Design

In RelativeLayout, which attribute would you use to position a view to the right of another view?
A) android:layout_alignRight
B) android:layout_toRightOf
C) android:layout_centerHorizontal
D) android:layout_marginRight

What does the android:layout_weight attribute do in LinearLayout?
A) Sets the physical weight of the view
B) Distributes available space proportionally among child views
C) Controls the view's opacity
D) Sets the view's priority in the layout

In ConstraintLayout, what does the following constraint mean: app:layout_constraintTop_toBottomOf="@id/button1"?
A) The view is positioned below button1
B) The view is positioned above button1
C) The view is aligned to the top of button1
D) The view is centered vertically with button1

Which attribute is used to add internal spacing within a view?
A) android:margin
B) android:padding
C) android:layout_margin
D) android:spacing

In RelativeLayout, what does android:layout_centerInParent="true" do?
A) Centers the view horizontally only
B) Centers the view vertically only
C) Centers the view both horizontally and vertically within the parent
D) Aligns the view to the center-left of the parent

Which units are recommended for text sizes in Android to ensure proper scaling across different screen densities?
A) px (pixels)
B) dp (density-independent pixels)
C) sp (scale-independent pixels)
D) pt (points)

In ConstraintLayout, what happens if a view has constraints to both left and right edges of the parent with equal bias?
A) The view will be positioned at the left edge
B) The view will be positioned at the right edge
C) The view will be centered horizontally
D) The constraints will conflict and cause an error

Which class is commonly used to bind an array of data to a ListView in Android?

A) ArrayList
B) ArrayAdapter
C) BaseAdapter
D) RecyclerViewAdapter

What is the purpose of setAdapter() method in ListView?

A) To set the layout of ListView
B) To set the data source for ListView
C) To set the orientation of ListView
D) To set the click listener for ListView

Which layout XML element is used to declare a ListView in your layout file?

A) <TextView>
B) <Button>
C) <ListView>
D) <RecyclerView>

Which method is used to handle click events on ListView items?

A) setOnClickListener()
B) setItemClickListener()
C) setOnItemClickListener()
D) setOnListItemClickListener()

In the setOnItemClickListener(), what does the position parameter represent?

A) The id of the item
B) The view of the item clicked
C) The position of the item clicked in the adapter
D) The text of the item clicked

Which interface must be implemented to listen to item click events in ListView?

A) View.OnClickListener
B) AdapterView.OnItemClickListener
C) ListView.OnClickListener
D) AdapterView.ItemClickListener

What happens if you do not set an adapter for your ListView?

A) It displays default data
B) It crashes immediately
C) It displays as an empty list
D) It shows a loading spinner

Which method inflates the layout for each row in a custom ArrayAdapter?

A) onCreateViewHolder()
B) getView()
C) bindView()
D) inflateRow()

How can you update the ListView when the underlying data changes?

A) Call adapter.notifyDataSetChanged()
B) Call listView.refresh()
C) Call setAdapter() again
D) Call adapter.update()

What is the main purpose of SharedPreferences in Android?

A) Store large files like videos
B) Store simple key-value pairs of primitive data
C) Store app resources
D) Store SQLite database tables

Which method is used to obtain a SharedPreferences instance?

A) getPreferences()
B) getSharedPreferences()
C) openPreferences()
D) createPreferences()

What mode is used for SharedPreferences to be private to the application?

A) MODE_WORLD_READABLE
B) MODE_APPEND
C) MODE_PRIVATE
D) MODE_MULTI_PROCESS

What is the correct way to save data to SharedPreferences?

A) Call putString() directly on SharedPreferences
B) Call edit(), then put value, then apply() or commit()
C) Call savePreferences()
D) Use SharedPreferencesManager.save()

Which method is used to read a string value from SharedPreferences?

A) getStringValue()
B) getString()
C) readString()
D) fetchString()

What is the difference between commit() and apply() when saving SharedPreferences?

A) commit() is asynchronous, apply() is synchronous
B) Both are identical
C) commit() is synchronous, apply() is asynchronous
D) apply() saves to external storage, commit() saves internally

Which of the following data types can NOT be directly saved in SharedPreferences?

A) String
B) int
C) boolean
D) Object

What will happen if you call getString() with a non-existing key without specifying a default value?

A) Returns null
B) Throws an exception
C) Returns empty string automatically
D) Returns “undefined”

Which interface is used to listen to changes in SharedPreferences data?

A) OnPreferenceChangeListener
B) SharedPreferences.OnSharedPreferenceChangeListener
C) PreferenceChangedListener
D) SharedPreferencesChangeListener

Where is the SharedPreferences data stored by default?

A) On external storage
B) In SQLite database
C) In an XML file in internal storage
D) In the cloud
